p: The United Nations Educational Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) works to document the medical heritage of peoples within its documentation of the living intangible cultural heritage of peoples and civilizations, through the documentation of TM practices that were included in the UNESCO convention (2003), the convention on biological diversity (1992) and the UNESCO universal declaration on cultural diversity (2001) and the United Nations declaration on the rights of indigenous peoples (2007), and according to the meeting of the UNESCO International Bioethics Committee (IBC) working group on TM and its ethical effects in Paris (2010), it stressed the need to conduct studies that illustrate the use of TM in various regions around the world, and its evaluation in clinical practice and in research and policy (IBC 2013).
